thread.title: Tams regain solo lead; Archers win
thread.title_full: Tams regain solo lead; Archers win | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Christian Jacinto
title: Tams regain solo lead; Archers win
text:
by Christian Jacinto
October 15, 2015 Games Saturday
(Mall of Asia Arena)
2 p.m. – Ateneo vs Adamson
4 p.m. – UST vs NU
Forward Mac Belo exploded just in time to help power Far Eastern University to a 68-57 win over University of the Philippines and into the solo lead of the UAAP basketball tournament last night at the Smart Araneta Coliseum.
The 6-foot-3 Belo scored nine of his 12 points in the payoff period, all of which came during a 20-6 run that turned a slim 43-40 lead into a commanding 63-46 advantage with roughly five minutes left in the contest.
Belo’s heroics propelled FEU to its seventh straight win and a league-best 8-1 record, a half-game ahead of idle University of Santo Tomas (7-1).
“I think the veterans decided that they’re going to play in that stretch,” said FEU Coach Nash Racela, whose team moved a win shy of clinching a playoff for a Final Four berth.
As in past games, Racela wasn’t pleased with his team’s performance.
“Marami silang narinig na sa akin during halftime,” he said. “They weren’t defending their men, they were underestimating the younger players. They waited for the fourth quarter bago sila nagtrabaho. It’s not a good sign for us.”
“But as long as we get the win, in the end that’s the only concern we have.”
Roger Pogoy led FEU with 17 points while Mike Tolomia added 11 markers.
Earlier, La Salle survived a big third quarter surge by University of the East before getting its bearings back in the payoff period to eke out a 72-64 victory and move to solo third at 5-4.
The Green Archers turned to Jeron Teng, Prince Rivero and Larry Muyang in the second half to win the game marred by the Big Dome’s new security measures that irked members of the media.
